title.narrative: NATIONAL FRAMEWORKS

description.narrative: Development of teacher training materials to support transitioning to Grade 1, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Early Learning, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, all boys, girls and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged among them, improved their education and developmental outcomes and access equitable and inclusive learning environments across the life cycle, including in emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Development of teacher training materials to support transitioning to Grade 1

description.narrative: National capacity building for early childhood services continued with an emphasis on teacher training using the evidence based, emotionally supportive Irie Classroom Toolbox (ICT) methodology which includes Functional Literacy and Numeracy content. ;As a result of the impact on the sector by the COVID-19 pandemic, the ICT methodology was converted to a blended approach and delivery at scale began through an ongoing, fruitful partnership with the national Early Childhood Commission (ECC) which saw all 96 ECC field staff trained and the first two cohorts totalling 420 practitioners each on track to complete the training by the first quarter of 2022 | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
